result.execSummary:
The defendant Tetasha M Blackshire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: $12,100.00 payable to Walmart JOINT AND SEVERAL with Colbert (case #15CF118).

Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and restitution surcharge; all applicable fees of supervision, to be paid by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- No Contact with the Walmart named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME; to be served over two weekends. Court STAYED commencement until 07-24-15 and 08-07-15 by 5pm each day.

records.addlTxt: See case no. 15cf118 for request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 10/14/15 for Justin R. for 1 appearance on 3/5/15.

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 6 days condition time, STRAIGH TIME, to be served over two weekends.  Court stayed commencement until 07/24/2015 and 08/07/2015 by 5pm each day.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the Walmart named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $12,100 payable to Walmart JOINT AND SEVERAL with Colbert (case# 15CF118); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Thomas Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the WalMart retail store at 401 East Capitol Drive, City of Milwaukee

Defendant Tetasha M Blackshire in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-032

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
